title: Social Media Videos (Los Angeles Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am requesting all records related to social media posts to any accounts outside the department's official accounts. Social media accounts include Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, and TikTok. 

Records related to content created, either officially or unofficially, where the department is featured. Content includes videos and photographs. 

Emails related to or with the following social media accounts:
@ten.thirty.three
@lojackhit
@pmtvla
@kanyedoit
@codesixphotography

Documents related to the approvals and requests for ride-alongs. 
Contracts with content creators
Documents related to payments for images and videos 
Search 2023 - 2024

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

title: Blue Bikes Program Financials

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Blue Bikes Program Financials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide all fiancials statements, projections or any documents that indicate the cost of operation of the blue bike program in the city of Boston. 2022, 2023 and 2024.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

title: 2024 Texas Body Camera Awards

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: 2024 Texas Body Camera Awards
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On December 18, 2024 Governor Abbott announced that the  Public Safety Office will administer over $500 million in grant funding for a variety of public safety programs and services in Texas, including 98 awards, totaling $4.6 million, to equip peace officers with body-worn camera systems.  Please provide a list of those agencies receiving body-worn camera awards, showing the amounts awarded to each agency (if available).  If a list of the awardees does not exist, please provide any documents, reports, data files, or communications that identify the award recipients.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Tepper

communications.communication:
Dear Ivan LEE: 
 
Thank you for your interest in the public records of the Austin Police Department. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 12/24/2024 and given the reference number R146768-122424 for tracking purposes. 
Please be advised that the Austin Police Department’s Central Records Division receives over 2500 requests for information a month. These requests are processed in the order received, and we strive to respond to each request promptly, as required by law. 
Please know that, as a result of the large volume of requests received, the anticipated timeframe for responding to your request may take 10 business days if it is simply an offense report you're requesting.  If you are requesting body cam, dash cam, or other related records your request could take up to 30 days. 
You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records requested. PLEASE NOTE: The Texas Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Austin Public Records Center. 
Austin Police Department

title: Lake Washington School District - Forrest Baker, Executive Director Technology Services (2023-2024)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Lake Washington School District - Forrest Baker, Executive Director Technology Services (2023-2024)
communications.communication:
via email to PublicRecordsRequest@lwsd.org

Lake Washington School District - Forrest Baker, Executive Director Technology Services (2023-2024)

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56

To whom it may concern,

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in athe following order of production, newest to oldest by year:

1. An electronic copy of the complete nonexempt personnel or employee file for Forrest Baker, Executive Director Technology Services.

2. An electronic copy of any and all complaints, disciplinary actions, warnings, investigations, lawsuits, reprimands, suspensions, and/or demotions, in any way referencing or referring to Forrest Baker.

3. An electronic copy of any and all emails, texts, or communications of any kind to or from Forrest Baker for the time period January 1, 2023 to December 23, 2024.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS - ORDER OF PRODUCTION

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in REVERSE CHRONOLOGICAL FORMAT BY DATE. The most recent public records should be produced first and the oldest records produced last by date.

DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS

RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

PRODUCTION PROCESSING AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

Washington State Law is clear that the use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA) for a public records request is optional for the requestor. Respectfully I decline. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment to this email address.

Please do not register this requestor for, nor direct this requestor to the use of any 3rd party commercial portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other online service other than a direct NO PASSWORD REQUIRED, NO REGISTRATION REQUIRED, internet cloud-based download link, or electronic email.

Do not send any portion of this public records request to any 3rd party for-profit corporation such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, NEXT-REQUEST, or JUST FOIA.

Do not register this request with any for profit portal or 3rd party organization such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, NEXT-REQUEST, or JUST FOIA.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format, either .pst file or .pdf PORTFOLIO file. Please provide all electronic records in the fewest number of individual files as per native format or use free .zip compression in each installment.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed contemporaneous exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC RECORDS *** ANTICIPATE LITIGATION ***

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

The lawful destruction of public records is governed by retention schedules. The unlawful destruction of public records can be a crime. RCW 40.16.010 and 40.16.020. An agency is prohibited from destroying a public record, even if it is about to be lawfully destroyed under a retention schedule, if a public records request has been made for that record. RCW 42.56.100. Additional retention requirements might apply if the records may be relevant to actual or anticipated litigation. The agency is required to retain the record until the record request has been resolved.

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

3. An electronic copy of any and all emails, texts, or communications of any kind to or from Dr. Jon Holmen for the time period January 1, 2023 to December 23, 2024.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS - ORDER OF PRODUCTION

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in REVERSE CHRONOLOGICAL FORMAT BY DATE. The most recent public records should be produced first and the oldest records produced last by date.

DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS

RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

PRODUCTION PROCESSING AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

Washington State Law is clear that the use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA) for a public records request is optional for the requestor. Respectfully I decline. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment to this email address.

Please do not register this requestor for, nor direct this requestor to the use of any 3rd party commercial portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other online service other than a direct NO PASSWORD REQUIRED, NO REGISTRATION REQUIRED, internet cloud-based download link, or electronic email.

Do not send any portion of this public records request to any 3rd party for-profit corporation such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, NEXT-REQUEST, or JUST FOIA.

Do not register this request with any for profit portal or 3rd party organization such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, NEXT-REQUEST, or JUST FOIA.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format, either .pst file or .pdf PORTFOLIO file. Please provide all electronic records in the fewest number of individual files as per native format or use free .zip compression in each installment.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed contemporaneous exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC RECORDS *** ANTICIPATE LITIGATION ***

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

The lawful destruction of public records is governed by retention schedules. The unlawful destruction of public records can be a crime. RCW 40.16.010 and 40.16.020. An agency is prohibited from destroying a public record, even if it is about to be lawfully destroyed under a retention schedule, if a public records request has been made for that record. RCW 42.56.100. Additional retention requirements might apply if the records may be relevant to actual or anticipated litigation. The agency is required to retain the record until the record request has been resolved.

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

communications.communication:
via email to PublicRecordsRequest@lwsd.org

Lake Washington School District - Matt Gillingham, Deputy Superintendent Equity, Community and Talent Strategy (2023-2024)

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56

To whom it may concern,

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in athe following order of production, newest to oldest by year:

1. An electronic copy of the complete nonexempt personnel or employee file for Matt Gillingham, Deputy Superintendent Equity, Community and Talent Strategy.

2. An electronic copy of any and all complaints, disciplinary actions, warnings, investigations, lawsuits, reprimands, suspensions, and/or demotions, in any way referencing or referring to Matt Gillingham.

3. An electronic copy of any and all emails, texts, or communications of any kind to or from Matt Gillingham for the time period January 1, 2023 to December 23, 2024.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS - ORDER OF PRODUCTION

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in REVERSE CHRONOLOGICAL FORMAT BY DATE. The most recent public records should be produced first and the oldest records produced last by date.

DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS

RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

PRODUCTION PROCESSING AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

Washington State Law is clear that the use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA) for a public records request is optional for the requestor. Respectfully I decline. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment to this email address.

Please do not register this requestor for, nor direct this requestor to the use of any 3rd party commercial portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other online service other than a direct NO PASSWORD REQUIRED, NO REGISTRATION REQUIRED, internet cloud-based download link, or electronic email.

Do not send any portion of this public records request to any 3rd party for-profit corporation such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, NEXT-REQUEST, or JUST FOIA.

Do not register this request with any for profit portal or 3rd party organization such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, NEXT-REQUEST, or JUST FOIA.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format, either .pst file or .pdf PORTFOLIO file. Please provide all electronic records in the fewest number of individual files as per native format or use free .zip compression in each installment.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed contemporaneous exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC RECORDS *** ANTICIPATE LITIGATION ***

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

The lawful destruction of public records is governed by retention schedules. The unlawful destruction of public records can be a crime. RCW 40.16.010 and 40.16.020. An agency is prohibited from destroying a public record, even if it is about to be lawfully destroyed under a retention schedule, if a public records request has been made for that record. RCW 42.56.100. Additional retention requirements might apply if the records may be relevant to actual or anticipated litigation. The agency is required to retain the record until the record request has been resolved.

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

title: OR ME records (statewide attempt 2)

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: OR ME records (statewide attempt 2)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to request all coroner's reports / medical examiner's reports / autopsy reports from 1/1/2019 to present (no earlier than 12/19/2024), conducted by or in the possession of the Medical Examiner Division, of individuals in Jackson County, Oregon and Curry County, Oregon who were

1) 70 years of age or older, and
2) died as a result of suicide using a firearm.

If your agency uses a different terminology for such reports, please assume that is responsive to my request. And if it is challenging on a practical level to search for some aspect of this request — such as to separate out suicides using a firearm from other suicides — I am open to receiving a larger number of reports in the case that cuts down on processing time.

I am a journalist with The Trace, a nonprofit journalism organization.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Aaron Mendelson

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56

To whom it may concern,

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in the following order of production, newest to oldest by year:

1. An electronic copy of the complete nonexempt personnel or employee file for Michele Sheetz, Front Desk.

2. An electronic copy of any and all complaints, disciplinary actions, warnings, investigations, lawsuits, reprimands, suspensions, and/or demotions, in any way referencing or referring to Michele Sheetz.

3. An electronic copy of any and all emails, texts, or communications of any kind to or from Michele Sheetz for the time period January 1, 2023 to December 23, 2024.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS - ORDER OF PRODUCTION

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in REVERSE CHRONOLOGICAL FORMAT BY DATE. The most recent public records should be produced first and the oldest records produced last by date.

DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS

RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

PRODUCTION PROCESSING AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

Washington State Law is clear that the use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA) for a public records request is optional for the requestor. Respectfully I decline. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment to this email address.

Please do not register this requestor for, nor direct this requestor to the use of any 3rd party commercial portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other online service other than a direct NO PASSWORD REQUIRED, NO REGISTRATION REQUIRED, internet cloud-based download link, or electronic email.

Do not send any portion of this public records request to any 3rd party for-profit corporation such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, NEXT-REQUEST, or JUST FOIA.

Do not register this request with any for profit portal or 3rd party organization such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, NEXT-REQUEST, or JUST FOIA.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format, either .pst file or .pdf PORTFOLIO file. Please provide all electronic records in the fewest number of individual files as per native format or use free .zip compression in each installment.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed contemporaneous exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC RECORDS *** ANTICIPATE LITIGATION ***

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

The lawful destruction of public records is governed by retention schedules. The unlawful destruction of public records can be a crime. RCW 40.16.010 and 40.16.020. An agency is prohibited from destroying a public record, even if it is about to be lawfully destroyed under a retention schedule, if a public records request has been made for that record. RCW 42.56.100. Additional retention requirements might apply if the records may be relevant to actual or anticipated litigation. The agency is required to retain the record until the record request has been resolved.

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

title: Lake Washington School District - Dale Cote, Associate Superintendent of School Support Services (2023-2024)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Lake Washington School District - Dale Cote, Associate Superintendent of School Support Services (2023-2024)
communications.communication:
via email to PublicRecordsRequest@lwsd.org

Lake Washington School District - Dale Cote, Associate Superintendent of School Support Services (2023-2024)

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56

To whom it may concern,

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in the following order of production, newest to oldest by year:

1. An electronic copy of the complete nonexempt personnel or employee file for Dale Cote, Associate Superintendent of School Support Services.

2. An electronic copy of any and all complaints, disciplinary actions, warnings, investigations, lawsuits, reprimands, suspensions, and/or demotions, in any way referencing or referring to Dale Cote.

3. An electronic copy of any and all emails, texts, or communications of any kind to or from Dale Cote for the time period January 1, 2023 to December 23, 2024.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS - ORDER OF PRODUCTION

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in REVERSE CHRONOLOGICAL FORMAT BY DATE. The most recent public records should be produced first and the oldest records produced last by date.

DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS

RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

PRODUCTION PROCESSING AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

Washington State Law is clear that the use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA) for a public records request is optional for the requestor. Respectfully I decline. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment to this email address.

Please do not register this requestor for, nor direct this requestor to the use of any 3rd party commercial portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other online service other than a direct NO PASSWORD REQUIRED, NO REGISTRATION REQUIRED, internet cloud-based download link, or electronic email.

Do not send any portion of this public records request to any 3rd party for-profit corporation such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, NEXT-REQUEST, or JUST FOIA.

Do not register this request with any for profit portal or 3rd party organization such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, NEXT-REQUEST, or JUST FOIA.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format, either .pst file or .pdf PORTFOLIO file. Please provide all electronic records in the fewest number of individual files as per native format or use free .zip compression in each installment.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed contemporaneous exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC RECORDS *** ANTICIPATE LITIGATION ***

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

The lawful destruction of public records is governed by retention schedules. The unlawful destruction of public records can be a crime. RCW 40.16.010 and 40.16.020. An agency is prohibited from destroying a public record, even if it is about to be lawfully destroyed under a retention schedule, if a public records request has been made for that record. RCW 42.56.100. Additional retention requirements might apply if the records may be relevant to actual or anticipated litigation. The agency is required to retain the record until the record request has been resolved.

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

title: OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, OAG, OIP , DOT and Medicaid Oversight Records FOIA (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Comprehensive FOIA Request Date: 12/23/2024

From: David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
39 Kings Hwy STE C
Gales Ferry, CT 06335

To: FOIA Officers
Office of Special Counsel, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, DOT, Congressional Budget Office, 

Subject:
Freedom of Information Act Request for OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, and Medicaid Oversight Records

Scope of Request
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request access to all records, communications, and materials under your agency’s control related to the following:

1. OSC Case Records
Complete files, internal and external communications, investigations, and resolutions regarding:
DI-25-000310
DI-25-000325
DI-25-000379
DI-12192024714
DI-12112024134

2. Interagency Correspondence
Communications between OSC, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, and relevant state agencies regarding:
Whistleblower disclosures and investigations.
Enforcement of ADA, Medicaid transparency, and constitutional compliance.
Allegations or investigations into fraud, retaliation, and procedural violations.

3. FBI Involvement
Documentation reflecting FBI’s role in addressing OSC-related investigations, whistleblower protections, and Medicaid compliance. Include:
Correspondence with OSC, DOJ, CMS and HHS regarding whistleblower allegations.
Investigative records and findings.

4. DOJ and HHS Oversight
DOJ Civil Rights Division and HHS OCR records related to:
ADA compliance investigations.
Complaints and procedural documentation under OCR Transaction Number 01-25-592844.
Federal and state enforcement actions against systemic non-compliance.

5. CMS and Medicaid Audits
All internal and external audits, investigations, and compliance reviews associated with the Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program.
Documents relating to whistleblower-reported fraud, misuse of funds, and oversight deficiencies.

6. FOIA Compliance Records
Metadata, processing logs, and communications related to this FOIA request, including:
Identified responsible officers and internal procedural reviews.
Justifications for redactions or denials under FOIA Exemptions (if applicable).
Legal Justifications
FOIA Statutory Mandates:
Under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(3), agencies are required to conduct comprehensive searches and produce responsive records unless clear statutory exemptions apply.

Whistleblower Protections:
OSC’s obligations under 5 U.S.C. § 1213 mandate thorough investigation and transparent communication regarding whistleblower allegations.

ADA Compliance:
Agencies must provide records in ADA-compliant formats under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132).

Constitutional Protections:
Denial or delay in producing these records infringes upon my First Amendment right to petition the government for grievances and procedural fairness under the Fifth and Fourteenth Amendments.

Delivery Requirements
To ensure accessibility and compliance with ADA standards, provide:

Screen-Reader Compatible Formats: All documents must be labeled and accessible for assistive technologies.
Exclusive MUCKROCK Platform Communication: No external links, portals, passwords, codes, physical mail, or phone calls.
Simplified Summaries: For complex or legal documents, include plain-language summaries.
Full name title of responsible officers and internal procedural for all communications.

Response Deadline
As per FOIA regulations, I expect a substantive response within 20 business days of receipt. If additional time is required, provide written justification and an estimated timeline.

Failure to comply will result in escalations, including judicial remedies and formal complaints to oversight entities.

Thank you for your cooperation in addressing this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt and thorough response.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources

title: OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, OAG, OIP , DOT and Medicaid Oversight Records FOIA (Department of Justice, Office of the Attorney General)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Comprehensive FOIA Request Date: 12/23/2024

From: David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
39 Kings Hwy STE C
Gales Ferry, CT 06335

To: FOIA Officers
Office of Special Counsel, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, DOT, Congressional Budget Office, 

Subject:
Freedom of Information Act Request for OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, and Medicaid Oversight Records

Scope of Request
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request access to all records, communications, and materials under your agency’s control related to the following:

1. OSC Case Records
Complete files, internal and external communications, investigations, and resolutions regarding:
DI-25-000310
DI-25-000325
DI-25-000379
DI-12192024714
DI-12112024134

2. Interagency Correspondence
Communications between OSC, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, and relevant state agencies regarding:
Whistleblower disclosures and investigations.
Enforcement of ADA, Medicaid transparency, and constitutional compliance.
Allegations or investigations into fraud, retaliation, and procedural violations.

3. FBI Involvement
Documentation reflecting FBI’s role in addressing OSC-related investigations, whistleblower protections, and Medicaid compliance. Include:
Correspondence with OSC, DOJ, CMS and HHS regarding whistleblower allegations.
Investigative records and findings.

4. DOJ and HHS Oversight
DOJ Civil Rights Division and HHS OCR records related to:
ADA compliance investigations.
Complaints and procedural documentation under OCR Transaction Number 01-25-592844.
Federal and state enforcement actions against systemic non-compliance.

5. CMS and Medicaid Audits
All internal and external audits, investigations, and compliance reviews associated with the Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program.
Documents relating to whistleblower-reported fraud, misuse of funds, and oversight deficiencies.

6. FOIA Compliance Records
Metadata, processing logs, and communications related to this FOIA request, including:
Identified responsible officers and internal procedural reviews.
Justifications for redactions or denials under FOIA Exemptions (if applicable).
Legal Justifications
FOIA Statutory Mandates:
Under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(3), agencies are required to conduct comprehensive searches and produce responsive records unless clear statutory exemptions apply.

Whistleblower Protections:
OSC’s obligations under 5 U.S.C. § 1213 mandate thorough investigation and transparent communication regarding whistleblower allegations.

ADA Compliance:
Agencies must provide records in ADA-compliant formats under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132).

Constitutional Protections:
Denial or delay in producing these records infringes upon my First Amendment right to petition the government for grievances and procedural fairness under the Fifth and Fourteenth Amendments.

Delivery Requirements
To ensure accessibility and compliance with ADA standards, provide:

Screen-Reader Compatible Formats: All documents must be labeled and accessible for assistive technologies.
Exclusive MUCKROCK Platform Communication: No external links, portals, passwords, codes, physical mail, or phone calls.
Simplified Summaries: For complex or legal documents, include plain-language summaries.
Full name title of responsible officers and internal procedural for all communications.

Response Deadline
As per FOIA regulations, I expect a substantive response within 20 business days of receipt. If additional time is required, provide written justification and an estimated timeline.

Failure to comply will result in escalations, including judicial remedies and formal complaints to oversight entities.

Thank you for your cooperation in addressing this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt and thorough response.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources



_____________________

title: OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, OAG, OIP , DOT and Medicaid Oversight Records FOIA (Department of Justice, Office of the Inspector General)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Comprehensive FOIA Request Date: 12/23/2024

From: David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
39 Kings Hwy STE C
Gales Ferry, CT 06335

To: FOIA Officers
Office of Special Counsel, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, DOT, Congressional Budget Office, 

Subject:
Freedom of Information Act Request for OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, and Medicaid Oversight Records

Scope of Request
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request access to all records, communications, and materials under your agency’s control related to the following:

1. OSC Case Records
Complete files, internal and external communications, investigations, and resolutions regarding:
DI-25-000310
DI-25-000325
DI-25-000379
DI-12192024714
DI-12112024134

2. Interagency Correspondence
Communications between OSC, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, and relevant state agencies regarding:
Whistleblower disclosures and investigations.
Enforcement of ADA, Medicaid transparency, and constitutional compliance.
Allegations or investigations into fraud, retaliation, and procedural violations.

3. FBI Involvement
Documentation reflecting FBI’s role in addressing OSC-related investigations, whistleblower protections, and Medicaid compliance. Include:
Correspondence with OSC, DOJ, CMS and HHS regarding whistleblower allegations.
Investigative records and findings.

4. DOJ and HHS Oversight
DOJ Civil Rights Division and HHS OCR records related to:
ADA compliance investigations.
Complaints and procedural documentation under OCR Transaction Number 01-25-592844.
Federal and state enforcement actions against systemic non-compliance.

5. CMS and Medicaid Audits
All internal and external audits, investigations, and compliance reviews associated with the Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program.
Documents relating to whistleblower-reported fraud, misuse of funds, and oversight deficiencies.

6. FOIA Compliance Records
Metadata, processing logs, and communications related to this FOIA request, including:
Identified responsible officers and internal procedural reviews.
Justifications for redactions or denials under FOIA Exemptions (if applicable).
Legal Justifications
FOIA Statutory Mandates:
Under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(3), agencies are required to conduct comprehensive searches and produce responsive records unless clear statutory exemptions apply.

Whistleblower Protections:
OSC’s obligations under 5 U.S.C. § 1213 mandate thorough investigation and transparent communication regarding whistleblower allegations.

ADA Compliance:
Agencies must provide records in ADA-compliant formats under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132).

Constitutional Protections:
Denial or delay in producing these records infringes upon my First Amendment right to petition the government for grievances and procedural fairness under the Fifth and Fourteenth Amendments.

Delivery Requirements
To ensure accessibility and compliance with ADA standards, provide:

Screen-Reader Compatible Formats: All documents must be labeled and accessible for assistive technologies.
Exclusive MUCKROCK Platform Communication: No external links, portals, passwords, codes, physical mail, or phone calls.
Simplified Summaries: For complex or legal documents, include plain-language summaries.
Full name title of responsible officers and internal procedural for all communications.

Response Deadline
As per FOIA regulations, I expect a substantive response within 20 business days of receipt. If additional time is required, provide written justification and an estimated timeline.

Failure to comply will result in escalations, including judicial remedies and formal complaints to oversight entities.

Thank you for your cooperation in addressing this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt and thorough response.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources



_____________________

title: OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, OAG, OIP , DOT and Medicaid Oversight Records FOIA (Department of Justice, Disability Rights Division)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Comprehensive FOIA Request Date: 12/23/2024

From: David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
39 Kings Hwy STE C
Gales Ferry, CT 06335

To: FOIA Officers
Office of Special Counsel, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, DOT, Congressional Budget Office, 

Subject:
Freedom of Information Act Request for OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, and Medicaid Oversight Records

Scope of Request
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request access to all records, communications, and materials under your agency’s control related to the following:

1. OSC Case Records
Complete files, internal and external communications, investigations, and resolutions regarding:
DI-25-000310
DI-25-000325
DI-25-000379
DI-12192024714
DI-12112024134

2. Interagency Correspondence
Communications between OSC, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, and relevant state agencies regarding:
Whistleblower disclosures and investigations.
Enforcement of ADA, Medicaid transparency, and constitutional compliance.
Allegations or investigations into fraud, retaliation, and procedural violations.

3. FBI Involvement
Documentation reflecting FBI’s role in addressing OSC-related investigations, whistleblower protections, and Medicaid compliance. Include:
Correspondence with OSC, DOJ, CMS and HHS regarding whistleblower allegations.
Investigative records and findings.

4. DOJ and HHS Oversight
DOJ Civil Rights Division and HHS OCR records related to:
ADA compliance investigations.
Complaints and procedural documentation under OCR Transaction Number 01-25-592844.
Federal and state enforcement actions against systemic non-compliance.

5. CMS and Medicaid Audits
All internal and external audits, investigations, and compliance reviews associated with the Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program.
Documents relating to whistleblower-reported fraud, misuse of funds, and oversight deficiencies.

6. FOIA Compliance Records
Metadata, processing logs, and communications related to this FOIA request, including:
Identified responsible officers and internal procedural reviews.
Justifications for redactions or denials under FOIA Exemptions (if applicable).
Legal Justifications
FOIA Statutory Mandates:
Under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(3), agencies are required to conduct comprehensive searches and produce responsive records unless clear statutory exemptions apply.

Whistleblower Protections:
OSC’s obligations under 5 U.S.C. § 1213 mandate thorough investigation and transparent communication regarding whistleblower allegations.

ADA Compliance:
Agencies must provide records in ADA-compliant formats under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132).

Constitutional Protections:
Denial or delay in producing these records infringes upon my First Amendment right to petition the government for grievances and procedural fairness under the Fifth and Fourteenth Amendments.

Delivery Requirements
To ensure accessibility and compliance with ADA standards, provide:

Screen-Reader Compatible Formats: All documents must be labeled and accessible for assistive technologies.
Exclusive MUCKROCK Platform Communication: No external links, portals, passwords, codes, physical mail, or phone calls.
Simplified Summaries: For complex or legal documents, include plain-language summaries.
Full name title of responsible officers and internal procedural for all communications.

Response Deadline
As per FOIA regulations, I expect a substantive response within 20 business days of receipt. If additional time is required, provide written justification and an estimated timeline.

Failure to comply will result in escalations, including judicial remedies and formal complaints to oversight entities.

Thank you for your cooperation in addressing this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt and thorough response.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources



_____________________

title: OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, OAG, OIP , DOT and Medicaid Oversight Records FOIA (Department of Justice - FOIA/PA Mail Referral Unit)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Comprehensive FOIA Request Date: 12/23/2024

From: David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
39 Kings Hwy STE C
Gales Ferry, CT 06335

To: FOIA Officers
Office of Special Counsel, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, DOT, Congressional Budget Office, 

Subject:
Freedom of Information Act Request for OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, and Medicaid Oversight Records

Scope of Request
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request access to all records, communications, and materials under your agency’s control related to the following:

1. OSC Case Records
Complete files, internal and external communications, investigations, and resolutions regarding:
DI-25-000310
DI-25-000325
DI-25-000379
DI-12192024714
DI-12112024134

2. Interagency Correspondence
Communications between OSC, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, and relevant state agencies regarding:
Whistleblower disclosures and investigations.
Enforcement of ADA, Medicaid transparency, and constitutional compliance.
Allegations or investigations into fraud, retaliation, and procedural violations.

3. FBI Involvement
Documentation reflecting FBI’s role in addressing OSC-related investigations, whistleblower protections, and Medicaid compliance. Include:
Correspondence with OSC, DOJ, CMS and HHS regarding whistleblower allegations.
Investigative records and findings.

4. DOJ and HHS Oversight
DOJ Civil Rights Division and HHS OCR records related to:
ADA compliance investigations.
Complaints and procedural documentation under OCR Transaction Number 01-25-592844.
Federal and state enforcement actions against systemic non-compliance.

5. CMS and Medicaid Audits
All internal and external audits, investigations, and compliance reviews associated with the Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program.
Documents relating to whistleblower-reported fraud, misuse of funds, and oversight deficiencies.

6. FOIA Compliance Records
Metadata, processing logs, and communications related to this FOIA request, including:
Identified responsible officers and internal procedural reviews.
Justifications for redactions or denials under FOIA Exemptions (if applicable).
Legal Justifications
FOIA Statutory Mandates:
Under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(3), agencies are required to conduct comprehensive searches and produce responsive records unless clear statutory exemptions apply.

Whistleblower Protections:
OSC’s obligations under 5 U.S.C. § 1213 mandate thorough investigation and transparent communication regarding whistleblower allegations.

ADA Compliance:
Agencies must provide records in ADA-compliant formats under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132).

Constitutional Protections:
Denial or delay in producing these records infringes upon my First Amendment right to petition the government for grievances and procedural fairness under the Fifth and Fourteenth Amendments.

Delivery Requirements
To ensure accessibility and compliance with ADA standards, provide:

Screen-Reader Compatible Formats: All documents must be labeled and accessible for assistive technologies.
Exclusive MUCKROCK Platform Communication: No external links, portals, passwords, codes, physical mail, or phone calls.
Simplified Summaries: For complex or legal documents, include plain-language summaries.
Full name title of responsible officers and internal procedural for all communications.

Response Deadline
As per FOIA regulations, I expect a substantive response within 20 business days of receipt. If additional time is required, provide written justification and an estimated timeline.

Failure to comply will result in escalations, including judicial remedies and formal complaints to oversight entities.

Thank you for your cooperation in addressing this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt and thorough response.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources



_____________________

title: OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, OAG, OIP , DOT and Medicaid Oversight Records FOIA (Office of Special Counsel)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Comprehensive FOIA Request Date: 12/23/2024

From: David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
39 Kings Hwy STE C
Gales Ferry, CT 06335

To: FOIA Officers
Office of Special Counsel, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, DOT, Congressional Budget Office, 

Subject:
Freedom of Information Act Request for OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, and Medicaid Oversight Records

Scope of Request
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request access to all records, communications, and materials under your agency’s control related to the following:

1. OSC Case Records
Complete files, internal and external communications, investigations, and resolutions regarding:
DI-25-000310
DI-25-000325
DI-25-000379
DI-12192024714
DI-12112024134

2. Interagency Correspondence
Communications between OSC, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, and relevant state agencies regarding:
Whistleblower disclosures and investigations.
Enforcement of ADA, Medicaid transparency, and constitutional compliance.
Allegations or investigations into fraud, retaliation, and procedural violations.

3. FBI Involvement
Documentation reflecting FBI’s role in addressing OSC-related investigations, whistleblower protections, and Medicaid compliance. Include:
Correspondence with OSC, DOJ, CMS and HHS regarding whistleblower allegations.
Investigative records and findings.

4. DOJ and HHS Oversight
DOJ Civil Rights Division and HHS OCR records related to:
ADA compliance investigations.
Complaints and procedural documentation under OCR Transaction Number 01-25-592844.
Federal and state enforcement actions against systemic non-compliance.

5. CMS and Medicaid Audits
All internal and external audits, investigations, and compliance reviews associated with the Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program.
Documents relating to whistleblower-reported fraud, misuse of funds, and oversight deficiencies.

6. FOIA Compliance Records
Metadata, processing logs, and communications related to this FOIA request, including:
Identified responsible officers and internal procedural reviews.
Justifications for redactions or denials under FOIA Exemptions (if applicable).
Legal Justifications
FOIA Statutory Mandates:
Under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(3), agencies are required to conduct comprehensive searches and produce responsive records unless clear statutory exemptions apply.

Whistleblower Protections:
OSC’s obligations under 5 U.S.C. § 1213 mandate thorough investigation and transparent communication regarding whistleblower allegations.

ADA Compliance:
Agencies must provide records in ADA-compliant formats under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132).

Constitutional Protections:
Denial or delay in producing these records infringes upon my First Amendment right to petition the government for grievances and procedural fairness under the Fifth and Fourteenth Amendments.

Delivery Requirements
To ensure accessibility and compliance with ADA standards, provide:

Screen-Reader Compatible Formats: All documents must be labeled and accessible for assistive technologies.
Exclusive MUCKROCK Platform Communication: No external links, portals, passwords, codes, physical mail, or phone calls.
Simplified Summaries: For complex or legal documents, include plain-language summaries.
Full name title of responsible officers and internal procedural for all communications.

Response Deadline
As per FOIA regulations, I expect a substantive response within 20 business days of receipt. If additional time is required, provide written justification and an estimated timeline.

Failure to comply will result in escalations, including judicial remedies and formal complaints to oversight entities.

Thank you for your cooperation in addressing this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt and thorough response.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources



_____________________

title: OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, OAG, OIP , DOT and Medicaid Oversight Records FOIA (Department of Health)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Comprehensive FOIA Request Date: 12/23/2024

From: David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
39 Kings Hwy STE C
Gales Ferry, CT 06335

To: FOIA Officers
Office of Special Counsel, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, DOT, Congressional Budget Office, 

Subject:
Freedom of Information Act Request for OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, and Medicaid Oversight Records

Scope of Request
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request access to all records, communications, and materials under your agency’s control related to the following:

1. OSC Case Records
Complete files, internal and external communications, investigations, and resolutions regarding:
DI-25-000310
DI-25-000325
DI-25-000379
DI-12192024714
DI-12112024134

2. Interagency Correspondence
Communications between OSC, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, and relevant state agencies regarding:
Whistleblower disclosures and investigations.
Enforcement of ADA, Medicaid transparency, and constitutional compliance.
Allegations or investigations into fraud, retaliation, and procedural violations.

3. FBI Involvement
Documentation reflecting FBI’s role in addressing OSC-related investigations, whistleblower protections, and Medicaid compliance. Include:
Correspondence with OSC, DOJ, CMS and HHS regarding whistleblower allegations.
Investigative records and findings.

4. DOJ and HHS Oversight
DOJ Civil Rights Division and HHS OCR records related to:
ADA compliance investigations.
Complaints and procedural documentation under OCR Transaction Number 01-25-592844.
Federal and state enforcement actions against systemic non-compliance.

5. CMS and Medicaid Audits
All internal and external audits, investigations, and compliance reviews associated with the Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program.
Documents relating to whistleblower-reported fraud, misuse of funds, and oversight deficiencies.

6. FOIA Compliance Records
Metadata, processing logs, and communications related to this FOIA request, including:
Identified responsible officers and internal procedural reviews.
Justifications for redactions or denials under FOIA Exemptions (if applicable).
Legal Justifications
FOIA Statutory Mandates:
Under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(3), agencies are required to conduct comprehensive searches and produce responsive records unless clear statutory exemptions apply.

Whistleblower Protections:
OSC’s obligations under 5 U.S.C. § 1213 mandate thorough investigation and transparent communication regarding whistleblower allegations.

ADA Compliance:
Agencies must provide records in ADA-compliant formats under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132).

Constitutional Protections:
Denial or delay in producing these records infringes upon my First Amendment right to petition the government for grievances and procedural fairness under the Fifth and Fourteenth Amendments.

Delivery Requirements
To ensure accessibility and compliance with ADA standards, provide:

Screen-Reader Compatible Formats: All documents must be labeled and accessible for assistive technologies.
Exclusive MUCKROCK Platform Communication: No external links, portals, passwords, codes, physical mail, or phone calls.
Simplified Summaries: For complex or legal documents, include plain-language summaries.
Full name title of responsible officers and internal procedural for all communications.

Response Deadline
As per FOIA regulations, I expect a substantive response within 20 business days of receipt. If additional time is required, provide written justification and an estimated timeline.

Failure to comply will result in escalations, including judicial remedies and formal complaints to oversight entities.

Thank you for your cooperation in addressing this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt and thorough response.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources



_____________________

title: OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, OAG, OIP , DOT and Medicaid Oversight Records FOIA (Department of Treasury)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Comprehensive FOIA Request Date: 12/23/2024

From: David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
39 Kings Hwy STE C
Gales Ferry, CT 06335

To: FOIA Officers
Office of Special Counsel, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, DOT, Congressional Budget Office, 

Subject:
Freedom of Information Act Request for OSC Cases DI-25-000310, DI-25-000325, DI-25-000379, DI-12192024714, and DI-12112024134; Associated FBI, DOJ, HHS, CMS, and Medicaid Oversight Records

Scope of Request
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request access to all records, communications, and materials under your agency’s control related to the following:

1. OSC Case Records
Complete files, internal and external communications, investigations, and resolutions regarding:
DI-25-000310
DI-25-000325
DI-25-000379
DI-12192024714
DI-12112024134

2. Interagency Correspondence
Communications between OSC, FBI, DOJ, CMS, HHS, and relevant state agencies regarding:
Whistleblower disclosures and investigations.
Enforcement of ADA, Medicaid transparency, and constitutional compliance.
Allegations or investigations into fraud, retaliation, and procedural violations.

3. FBI Involvement
Documentation reflecting FBI’s role in addressing OSC-related investigations, whistleblower protections, and Medicaid compliance. Include:
Correspondence with OSC, DOJ, CMS and HHS regarding whistleblower allegations.
Investigative records and findings.

4. DOJ and HHS Oversight
DOJ Civil Rights Division and HHS OCR records related to:
ADA compliance investigations.
Complaints and procedural documentation under OCR Transaction Number 01-25-592844.
Federal and state enforcement actions against systemic non-compliance.

5. CMS and Medicaid Audits
All internal and external audits, investigations, and compliance reviews associated with the Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program.
Documents relating to whistleblower-reported fraud, misuse of funds, and oversight deficiencies.

6. FOIA Compliance Records
Metadata, processing logs, and communications related to this FOIA request, including:
Identified responsible officers and internal procedural reviews.
Justifications for redactions or denials under FOIA Exemptions (if applicable).
Legal Justifications
FOIA Statutory Mandates:
Under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(3), agencies are required to conduct comprehensive searches and produce responsive records unless clear statutory exemptions apply.

Whistleblower Protections:
OSC’s obligations under 5 U.S.C. § 1213 mandate thorough investigation and transparent communication regarding whistleblower allegations.

ADA Compliance:
Agencies must provide records in ADA-compliant formats under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132).

Constitutional Protections:
Denial or delay in producing these records infringes upon my First Amendment right to petition the government for grievances and procedural fairness under the Fifth and Fourteenth Amendments.

Delivery Requirements
To ensure accessibility and compliance with ADA standards, provide:

Screen-Reader Compatible Formats: All documents must be labeled and accessible for assistive technologies.
Exclusive MUCKROCK Platform Communication: No external links, portals, passwords, codes, physical mail, or phone calls.
Simplified Summaries: For complex or legal documents, include plain-language summaries.
Full name title of responsible officers and internal procedural for all communications.

Response Deadline
As per FOIA regulations, I expect a substantive response within 20 business days of receipt. If additional time is required, provide written justification and an estimated timeline.

Failure to comply will result in escalations, including judicial remedies and formal complaints to oversight entities.

Thank you for your cooperation in addressing this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt and thorough response.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources



_____________________

title: OMI Otero Death Autopsy

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records relating to any autopsy, review, or consultation performed by OMI on Jhon Javier Benavides Quintana, who died at the Otero County Processing Center on June 15, 2024. See https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/ecuadoran-national-passes-away-ice-custody. 

Thank you in advance for your response to this IPRA request! 

Andrew Free

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

title: Body Camera Footage (8/27/2022)

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Body Camera Footage (8/27/2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All unedited body-worn camera / bodycam recordings related to the following law enforcement critical incident:


Incident Date: August 27, 2022, 7:00 PM
Location: Near 708 Ogden Ave, Superior, WI 54880
Suspect Name: Jason

Type of Incident: battery on a LEO
Reason for Police Response: Forcefully taking girlfriend's money at a strip club
The patrol car license plate numbers dispatched at the time: E8102, E7102

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Ivan LEE

title: CEO Emails

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: CEO Emails
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to request copies of all emails sent or received by the department between 12/10/24 and 12/18/24 (inclusive) containing one or more of the terms "Deloitte", "United Health",  "IBM".

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daniel Boguslaw

Daniel Boguslaw
